Class ticTac

  • java.lang.Object
    • ticTac

  • public class ticTac
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a program that runs a two player tic tac toe game, with the size of the board decided by the user It is a two player game, where players can decide their symbols and decide where they want to place it by inputting a number on the board. If one of the player wins, or the game ends in a tie, a message will be printed that reveals the results, and then the game ends

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method that calls upon all other methods, initiates the game, and asks for the user’s input using scanner. Checks that each user input is valid for that situation by calling upon error handling and checking if it meets the specifications (if & while)

      • initBoard

        public static java.lang.String[][] initBoard(int n)
        This method uses a for loop to initialized and populated a 2d String array of the inputted size for the tic tac toe game. For example, if 3 is inputted, 1 - 9 would populated a 2d array (3 by 3)
        Parameters:
        int - n size of 2d string array to be initiated for the tic tac toe board
        Returns:
        String[][] board initialized with inputted size for tic tac toe board

      • printBoard

        public static void printBoard(java.lang.String[][] board,
              int n)
        This method prints out the board on the screen from the 2s String array made by initBoard. Uses a for loop and a nested for loop to go through each “row” and “column” in the array and print it.
        Parameters:
        String[][] - board tic tac toe board to be printed on the screen
        int - n board size inputted by user

      • playSymbol

        public static void playSymbol(java.lang.String[][] a,
              java.lang.String spot,
              java.lang.String symbol,
              int boardSize)
        This method puts the user's symbol, into the designated spot on the board that they picked. uses a nested loop to find the spot inside of the 2d array, and then changes the string in that spot to the users symbol
        Parameters:
        a - is the 2d list holding the contents of the board
        symbol - is the user’s symbol who is up currently
        spot - is the spot the user chose to place their symbol on
        boardSize - is the size of the board that the game is being played on

      • checkAcross

        public static boolean checkAcross(java.lang.String[][] board,
                  java.lang.String symbol,
                  int n)
        This method checks if the player currently going has won going across the board. It uses nested for loops to check if the symbol is in the spot that the loop is currently on *and then the counter increases by one depending on if it is or not. If the counter equals *the amount of rows then this method will return true but if not then it will return false
        Parameters:
        board - is the current board for the game with symbols and numbers in it
        symbol - is the symbol the user has picked
        n - is the number of rows in the board
        Returns:
        true is there is a winner by going across

      • checkDown

        public static boolean checkDown(java.lang.String[][] board,
                java.lang.String symbol,
                int n)
        This method checks if the current player has won by getting n in a row going down. Uses 2 nested for loops to check the contents of the 2D array. If it finds a symbol, the counter goes up. At the end, if the counter equals n, then it returns true
        Parameters:
        board - the 2D array that represents the tic tac toe board and its contents
        symbol - the current string symbol of the player that just inputted a number on the board
        n - the integer that decides the size of the board. The board size will be n*n
        Returns:
        bool value that tells if the player won going down, true if they did, false if they didn't

      • checkDiagonal

        public static boolean checkDiagonal(java.lang.String[][] board,
                    java.lang.String symbol,
                    int n)
        This method checks if the current player has won by getting n in a row going down. Uses for loops to check the contents of the 2D array. If it finds a symbol, the counter goes up. At the end, if the counter equals n, then it returns true Has to check both diagonals, left to right and right to left
        Parameters:
        board - the 2D array that represents the tic tac toe board and its contents
        symbol - the current string symbol of the player that just inputted a number on the board
        n - the integer that decides the size of the board. The board size will be n*n
        Returns:
        true if the player won diagonally

      • inRange

        public static boolean inRange(java.lang.String[][] a,
              java.lang.String spot,
              int size)
        Makes sure the spot selection of each player is valid Checks to make sure the spot is a number first by comparing ascii chars Comparing the value of the int, makes sure the spot is no less than 1 and no greater than the board’s size Makes sure the spot is not already taken by comparing to a list of spots already used
        Parameters:
        the - desired user inputted location to place their symbol
        the - list of spots already occupied
        the - size of a side of the board
        Returns:
        false if spot is invalid, true if valid

      • errorHandlingSymbols

        public static java.lang.String errorHandlingSymbols(java.lang.String userSymbol)
        Makes sure user inputted symbol has a length of 1 and makes sure it is not a number Uses an if and else if statement to check both conditions userSymbol.length() to check length converts symbol to ascii, makes sure it is not a number based on comparing ascii chars If the user’s symbol doesn’t follow the criteria, they are asked to input a different one
        Parameters:
        the - user’s inputted symbol
        Returns:
        user symbol if fits criteria, if not, the newly inputted symbol once approved

      • errorHandlingRows

        public static java.lang.String errorHandlingRows(java.lang.String userRows)
        This method makes sure that the users input of the amount of rows is a number. It does it by turning userRows into the ascii value and then making sure that they are in between 0 and 9 on the ascii table
        Parameters:
        userRows - is the users input on the amount of rows they would like to have
        Returns:
        userRows if it is a number or else the code will be called again
